intro: Alcea calvertii, commonly known as the Calvert's hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other hollyhocks and cotton plants. The plant produces showy, rose-like flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Alcea calvertii is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
